intro: Leucomphalos, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. They typically have slender stems and heart-shaped or ovate leaves. Leucomphalos species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
